access.description: The registered URL returns a clean, server-rendered HTML page at 200 OK with no redirects, no login, no anti-bot protection, and no JavaScript requirements. The page contains a brief description of the EHI export and two links: an online browsable index at /EHITables/TechSpec and a direct ZIP download at /EHITables/Download. The ZIP downloads immediately with a Content-Disposition header. This is the gold standard for documentation accessibility.

products.name: Epic EHR
certified_module_names: Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting (February 2025)
Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting (May 2025)
Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting (August 2025)
Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting (November 2025)

product_context.description: Epic is the dominant EHR vendor in the US, powering approximately 38% of the hospital market and a larger share by patient lives covered. The five certified modules (EpicCare Ambulatory Base, EpicCare Inpatient Base, Beaker Reportable Labs Reporting, Beacon Cancer Registry Reporting, Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting) are components of the broader Epic EHR platform. Epic is a fully integrated system — not modular best-of-breed. A typical Epic installation includes: EpicCare (ambulatory + inpatient clinical), MyChart (patient portal with messaging and bill pay), Cadence (scheduling), Resolute (professional and hospital billing/revenue cycle), Beaker (laboratory), Radiant (radiology), Beacon (oncology), OpTime (surgical/perioperative), Prelude (registration/ADT), Grand Central (bed management), Tapestry (managed care), Healthy Planet (population health), and more. All modules share a single integrated database.

export_approach.description: Epic's EHI export is a native database dump — the gold standard approach. The export provides 7,672 tables/views from Epic's Clarity reporting database (the relational layer over their Chronicles operational database) as tab-separated value (TSV) files. This is not a FHIR export or C-CDA generation — it is the actual database schema with all stored data. Epic additionally created 89 purpose-built V_EHI_* views specifically for the EHI export, supplementing existing Clarity tables with audit trails, billing details, flowsheet measurements, and coverage history. Non-tabular data (rich text documents, images) are referenced from the tables and provided as a separate binary download.

documentation_quality.description: Excellent documentation quality. Each of the 7,672 tables has its own HTML file with: a plain-English description of the table's purpose, primary key definition (column names and ordinal positions), and detailed column information including ordinal number, column name, data type (VARCHAR, NUMERIC, DATETIME, FLOAT, INTEGER), discontinued status, plain-English description of each column, category entries (enumerated values with names where applicable), foreign key hints (e.g., 'frequently used to link to the PATIENT table'), and organization-specific value flags. The index page provides an alphabetical listing of all tables. Documentation is version-stamped (February 2026 release, generated 2/12/2026 at 2:10 PM CT) and regenerated with each quarterly release.

ehi_coverage.overall_assessment: Epic's EHI export is the most comprehensive in the industry. All 7 EHI categories are present with extensive, deep coverage. With 7,672 tables/views from the native database — including 89 purpose-built V_EHI_* views for audit trails and billing — the export covers the complete breadth of the Epic platform: clinical (diagnoses, medications, labs, vitals, notes, orders, surgery, oncology), all messaging channels (MyChart patient-provider, In Basket provider-to-provider, Secure Chat), full billing/revenue cycle (claims, transactions, hospital accounts, payments), insurance/coverage (benefits, authorizations, referrals, eligibility), scheduling (encounters, appointments, surgical scheduling), documents/images (DICOM, scanned documents, attachments), and comprehensive audit trails (who changed what, when, with old/new values). There are no apparent gaps between the product's capabilities and the export's coverage. This is the benchmark.

clinical.evidence: Hundreds of clinical tables: PROBLEM_LIST/PROBLEM_LIST_ALL (22+ problem tables), ALLERGY/PAT_ALLERGIES (3+), CLARITY_MEDICATION/ORDER_MED through ORDER_MED_8 (20+ medication tables), IP_FLWSHT_MEAS/IP_FLWSHT_REC/V_EHI_FLO_MEAS_VALUE (17+ vitals/flowsheet tables), CLARITY_IMMUNZATN/IMMUNE (8 immunization tables), LAB_CASE_*/CLARITY_COMPONENT (10+ lab tables), HNO_INFO/HNO_PLAIN_TEXT (16+ clinical notes tables), ORDER_PROC/ORDER_RESULTS (158+ order tables), OR_CASE/OR_LOG (179 surgical tables), SOCIAL_HX_*/FAMILY_HX_* (social/family history). Additionally extensive oncology (BEACON_*/CANCER_*), OB (STORK_*), dental, and other specialty tables.

secure_messages.evidence: 71+ messaging tables covering all channels: MYC_MESG (28+ sub-tables) for MyChart patient-provider portal messages including attachments and RTF text; MYC_CONVO/MYC_CONVO_MSGS for threaded conversations; IB_MESSAGES through IB_MESSAGES_5 (22 tables) for In Basket provider-to-provider messaging; CHAT_MESSAGE/CHAT_CONVERSATIONS/CHAT_PARTICIPANT (18 CHAT_* tables) for Secure Chat with message types including text, images, and system messages; MSG_TXT/MESSAGE_METADATA/IB_MESSAGE_THREAD for message content and threading; DOCS_RCVD_PAT_IB_MSG/DOCS_RCVD_PAT_MYC_MSG for document-linked messages.

billing_financial.evidence: 776+ billing/financial tables — the largest category. AP_CLAIM and 377 AP_CLAIM_* sub-tables with claim status, total billed amount, patient portion, net payable. ARPB_TRANSACTIONS through ARPB_TRANSACTIONS_4 plus 51 ARPB_* tables for professional billing. HSP_ACCOUNT through HSP_ACCOUNT_5 plus 108 HSP_ACCT_* tables for hospital accounts with charges, DRGs, CPT codes. ACCT_TX for account transactions. BILL_SCHED_PMT and 12 sub-tables for scheduled payments. 18+ V_EHI_PAX/PBA/PBI/PTS billing views purpose-built for EHI export.

insurance_coverage.evidence: 327+ insurance/coverage tables. COVERAGE through COVERAGE_5 with coverage type, payor ID, plan ID, COBRA status. COVERAGE_BENEFITS/COVERAGE_MEMBER_LIST/COVERAGE_STATUS/COVERAGE_STATUS_HX. AUTHORIZATIONS/AUTHORIZATIONS_2 for prior auth records. BENEFITS/BENEFITS_TEMPLATE/BENEFIT_SVC_TYPE. CLARITY_CARRIER for insurance carrier master. REFERRAL_* tables. V_EHI_COVERAGE_SUBS/V_EHI_CVG_BEN_ACCUM_AT/V_EHI_CVG_COVERAGE_HIST_ALL/V_EHI_CVG_COVERAGE_HIST_MEM EHI-specific coverage views.

appointments_scheduling.evidence: 249+ scheduling tables. PAT_ENC through PAT_ENC_8 and 115 PAT_ENC_* sub-tables — the core encounter record covering appointments, office visits, telephone encounters with dates, providers, financial class. APPT_REQUEST/APPT_SELF_CHECKIN_INFO/CANCELED_APPTS_EDI for appointment workflow. MYC_APPT_QNR_DATA for MyChart appointment questionnaires. OR_CASE and 179 sub-tables for surgical scheduling. HH_PAT_ENC for home health encounters.

documents_images.evidence: 54+ document/image metadata tables. 8 DICOM_* tables (definitions, manifests, instances, series, slices). SCAN_IMAGE/REQ_SCAN/RES_SCAN_FILES for scanned documents. DOCUMENT_SIG_DATA/DOCUMENT_SMARTFORM_LIST/DOCUMENT_STAMPS. ORDER_DOCUMENTS/ORDER_RESULT_DOCUMENTS/ORDER_IMAGE_URL. AP_CLAIM_ATTACHMENTS/AP_CLAIM_PROC_ATTACHMENTS/REFERRAL_ATTACHMENTS. FINDING_IMAGES_METADATA/LINKED_IMAGES. Note: actual binary files (images, rich text documents) are in a separate companion download referenced by these tables.

audit_trails.evidence: 197+ audit tables, many purpose-built for EHI. 29 V_EHI_AUDIT_* views covering patient records (EPT), encounters (EPT_ENC), hospital accounts (HAR), claims (CLM), coverage (CVG), benefits (BEN), referrals (RFL), orders, therapy — each with PAT_ID, CHANGE_TIME, CHANGED_DATA_ELEMENT, NEW_VALUE_EXTERNAL, OLD_VALUE_EXTERNAL, USER_ID (who changed what, when, with before/after values). 18 V_EHI_REG_ITEM_AUDIT_* views for registration audits. Domain-specific audits: ORDER_AUDIT_TRL, CHAT_ACCESS_LOG, CHAT_ACTION_LOG, MYC_CONVO_EXPORT_AUDIT, CONSENT_LINK_AUDIT, RX_FILL_PROCESS_AUDITS, NOTES_HISTORY_LOG, etc.

issues: No significant issues. This is the gold standard for EHI export documentation and coverage.

Minor caveat: The landing page notes that actual export content varies by health system based on installed applications, Epic version, configuration, and documentation practices. This is inherent to Epic's architecture and is a factual disclaimer.

Non-tabular data (images, rich text documents) are referenced from the TSV tables but provided as a separate binary download — the documentation covers the table schema but not the binary file formats.
products.summary: Epic's EHI export is the industry benchmark: 7,672 native database tables/views exported as TSV files, covering all 7 EHI categories with extensive depth. Epic invested in 89 purpose-built V_EHI_* views specifically for the export, including comprehensive audit trails. Documentation is well-structured, field-level, version-stamped, and freely accessible.

downloaded_files.description: Complete EHI Export Schema documentation. Contains 7,674 files: 1 CSS stylesheet, 1 HTML index page, and 7,672 individual HTML table documentation files. Each file documents one database table/view with description, primary key, column names, data types, column descriptions, enumerated values, and foreign key hints. Generated 2/12/2026 from February 2026 release.

summary: Epic Systems Corporation provides the gold standard for EHI export documentation. A single ZIP file at a clean, publicly accessible URL contains schema documentation for 7,672 native database tables/views exported as TSV files. The export covers all 7 EHI categories comprehensively — clinical, secure messages (MyChart, In Basket, Secure Chat), billing/financial (776+ tables), insurance/coverage, appointments/scheduling, documents/images, and audit trails (with 89 purpose-built V_EHI_* views). No access barriers, no login required, regularly updated with quarterly releases.
notes: All 20 CHPL IDs (5 certified modules × 4 quarterly releases) point to the same EHI documentation URL, which is correct — they are all components of one integrated Epic platform sharing a single database and export mechanism. The 5 modules are EpicCare Ambulatory Base, EpicCare Inpatient Base, Beaker Reportable Labs Reporting, Beacon Cancer Registry Reporting, and Infection Control Antimicrobial Use and Resistance Reporting.
